#summary dates_in_range - prints all of the dates within a range

= Usage =

`dates_in_range <options> <-s YYYY-MM-DD> <-e YYYY-MM-DD>`

Date format strings consist of YYYY, MM, DD, HH, MI, and SS

= Options =
||*Short Opt*||*Long Opt*||*Argument*||*Description*||
||-h||--help|| ||print this message and exit||
||-s||--start||<start> ||beginning of the range||
||-e||--end||<end> ||end of the range||
||-f||--format||<format> ||alternate output date format||
||-i||--increment||<increment> ||specifies the number of days by which to increment||
